intro: Wedelia frioana, commonly known as the Mexican tricolor grass, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow-orange flowers that are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is often grown as an ornamental plant for its vibrant color and drought tolerance. Wedelia frioana thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid regions.
